content:
It is understandable that you want to take control of your own health and fitness, and it is good that you are proactive in seeking out ways to improve your flexibility. However, it is still recommended that you seek professional guidance from a physical therapist or physician, especially if you have a pre-existing injury.

While you may know your body well, a healthcare professional has specialized knowledge and expertise in diagnosing and treating injuries, and can provide tailored recommendations to meet your specific needs.

Furthermore, attempting to treat an injury on your own can sometimes exacerbate the problem, leading to more serious or long-lasting issues. Without proper guidance, you may unknowingly perform stretches or exercises that may be contraindicated or may worsen your injury.

In terms of time and money, investing in proper guidance and treatment can actually save you time and money in the long run by reducing the likelihood of further complications or setbacks, and by helping you to recover more quickly and effectively.
